entities.name: Spirit of the Game
entities.description: A set of principles emphasizing fair play, respect, and joy in Ultimate.

entities.name: goal
entities.description: Achieved when a player catches a legal pass in the end zone they are attacking.

entities.name: turnover
entities.description: Occurs when a pass is incomplete, intercepted, or goes out-of-bounds.

entities.name: thrower
entities.description: The offensive player in possession of the disc.

entities.name: marker
entities.description: The defensive player within ten feet of the thrower, responsible for counting stalls.

entities.name: receiver
entities.description: The player attempting to catch the disc.

entities.name: foul
entities.description: Non-incidental contact between opposing players.

entities.name: violation
entities.description: Any infraction of the rules other than a foul.

entities.name: pivot
entities.description: The part of the body in continuous contact with a single spot on the field during possession.

entities.name: pull
entities.description: The throw that starts play at the beginning of a half or after a goal.

entities.name: possession
entities.description: Sustained contact with and control of a non-spinning disc.

entities.name: in-bounds
entities.description: The status of a player or disc within the playing field boundaries.

entities.name: out-of-bounds
entities.description: The status of a player or disc outside the playing field boundaries.

entities.name: end zone
entities.description: The area where goals are scored.

entities.name: central zone
entities.description: The playing field excluding the end zones.

entities.name: stall count
entities.description: The period within which a thrower must release a throw, counted by the marker.

entities.name: check
entities.description: The action to resume play after a stoppage.

entities.name: brick mark
entities.description: A mark in the central zone used for starting play after certain stoppages.

entities.name: live disc
entities.description: A disc that is subject to a turnover but cannot be legally passed yet.

entities.name: dead disc
entities.description: A disc when play has stopped and can continue only with a check.

entities.name: completed pass
entities.description: A catch that results in the team retaining possession of the disc.

entities.name: best perspective
entities.description: The most complete view available by a player regarding a play.

entities.name: dangerous play
entities.description: Actions demonstrating reckless disregard for safety, treated as a foul.

entities.name: travel
entities.description: Occurs when a thrower fails to establish or maintain a pivot.

entities.name: pick
entities.description: Occurs when an offensive player obstructs a defender's path.

entities.name: timeout
entities.description: A stoppage of play for rest, injury, or technical reasons.

entities.name: injury timeout
entities.description: A stoppage of play due to a player injury.

entities.name: technical timeout
entities.description: A stoppage of play for illegal equipment or dangerous conditions.

entities.name: spirit timeout
entities.description: A stoppage of play to address Spirit of the Game issues.

entities.name: observers
entities.description: Non-player officials who support players in implementing a fair game.

relationships.name: causes
relationships.description: One concept leads to or results in another.
relationships.example: A foul causes a stoppage of play.

relationships.name: prevents
relationships.description: One concept stops another from occurring.
relationships.example: A turnover prevents the offensive team from continuing their possession.

relationships.name: requires
relationships.description: One concept needs another to occur or be valid.
relationships.example: A completed pass requires possession of the disc.

relationships.name: invalidates
relationships.description: One concept makes another void or ineffective.

relationships.name: is part of
relationships.description: One concept is a component or element of another.
relationships.example: A stall count is part of the marker's responsibilities.

relationships.name: is opposite of
relationships.description: One concept is the direct contrast to another.
relationships.example: In-bounds is the opposite of out-of-bounds.

relationships.name: is a type of
relationships.description: One concept is a specific instance or category of another.
relationships.example: A spirit timeout is a type of timeout.

relationships.name: is determined by
relationships.description: One concept is decided or defined by another.
relationships.example: Best perspective is determined by the player's view of the play.

relationships.name: changes state to
relationships.description: One concept alters the condition or status of another.
relationships.example: A check changes a dead disc to a live disc.

relationships.name: is enforced by
relationships.description: One concept is upheld or applied by another.
relationships.example: Spirit of the Game is enforced by players and observers.
